intro: Platystele rhinocera, commonly known as the rhinoceros platystele, is a rare epiphytic orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and intricate floral structure. The plant produces striking, white, star-shaped flowers that are typically short-lived but highly attractive to pollinators. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and faces threats from habitat loss and climate change. Conservation efforts are crucial to preserving this unique botanical species.
